Articles.Content:
I'm surprised this hasn't been done yet, did a quick search before I posted it just to make sure.

Anyway, the challenge:

The Planetary Time Challenge

-Image coming later-

This challenge, is to simply be the quickest (without dying as well, with the exception of Jool) to land on a certain planet/moon (you don't have to come back but you can if you want, I might make a special list for those people). Want to try and beat the previous record holder and become the fastest or attempt a planet that hasn't been done before and set your own record? It's all up to you and good luck on your journey.

Rules:

1. Screenshots/Video needed for Launch, Kerbin Orbit, Kerbol Orbit (if not going to Mun/Minmus), Inside the SOI of your planet/moon and landing as well at Total Mission Time.

2. No autopilot/Debug console or other cheaty mods, I'm fine with MechJeb and others for data collection and certain other features but you can't use the autopilots.

3. If you are using mod parts, you will go on a separate leaderboard so everything is fair.

4. If you are using mods, please state which ones you are using so I can easily judge which leaderboard you need to go on.

Format is Days, Hours, Mins, Seconds.

Need Validation:

tjitte: I need all the required images or I can't add you.

Aescwulf: I need all the required screenshots except the landing one (good time).

Tell me if this has been done before and I will ask a moderator to close the thread, I've found before that the search function on this forums software isn't that good. Also, any suggestions would be much appreciated.

Edited September 30, 2012 by mustwinfull
i made it to laythe in about 205 day's and a somewat edited feultank
I leave a trail of dead bodies behind me, but I might attempt this time trial.

i made it to laythe in about 205 day's and a somewat edited feultank

I need proof or you are not going on the leaderboard. I can't possibly tell at the minute.

I leave a trail of dead bodies behind me, but I might attempt this time trial.

Looking forward to it and I know realize my spelling mistake, oops and thanks.

EDIT: I've corrected everything except the picture now and thanks again.

Edited September 29, 2012 by mustwinfull

I might attempt this time trial.

Yeah, one destination isn't much of a trail.

Yeah, one destination isn't much of a trail.

I'm pretty sure he was pointing out my spelling mistake but I can change it if the majority want it, I'm not going to force something everyone doesn't like.

How can I make it better then? I'm open to suggestions.

Also, I looked up the definition of trial and it seems fine to me but I might change it's name if any more confusion arises.

EDIT: I've changed the name, is it OK now?

Edited September 29, 2012 by mustwinfull

Comment: Allowing a leaderboard for modded parts that does not allow .cfg edits is stupid. Mods are created by editing cfg files!

You should allow the guy who landed on Laythe with an edited fuel tank on the modded leaderboard.

Also, 576 days to eve

i know il try again and hope i have the same luck again..

i know il try again and hope i have the same luck again..

Looking forward to it . Good luck with your mission.

Figured I would see how well I could do getting to Mun. For this trip, I used my highly reliable Coon Craft, a 168.7 ton general purpose ship. I suppose a better time could be had with a ship specifically designed for this mission.

I know sub 4 hours is possible, so I expect someone to beat me soon

Final time - 4:43:44

I included some screenshots that help show my thought process.. accelerating directly toward Mun to shorten the time until impact.

http://imgur.com/a/PWDon

Well done, adding your score to the leaderboard now.

Oops sorry. When i was going to Mun i didn't have this challenge in mind. Then as i was searching through to see what challenge i could do then i saw this and went " PERFECT " and then replied to the thread

Minmus, 18 hrs, 59 minutes, 42 seconds. No mods, cheats, or even mid-flight saves/reloads. I lost the descent stage on landing, but Danlin is alive!
